poem:
Title: The Politics of Expectations

Trump's plan – 
a dance in Iowa fields,
whirling caucus winds 
and margins yield. 

Polling's pencil 
sketched five or ten,
a litmus stain 
awaiting when.

Absent concern -
another guise,
in election's harvest
truth belies. 

A multitude playing 
mandolin of states,
Each cord echoing 
with the weight of fates.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Why Trump plans to win in Iowa – and all the other states as well Donald Trump’s presidential campaign anticipates winning the Iowa state caucuses and advisers have suggested internally they would only be concerned about the former president being upstaged if another candidate started polling within five or 10 points, according to people close to the campaign. The margin of the expected win has been an informal litmus test for several weeks, and with". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
